meanings.definition: A person designated to act for or represent another.
meanings.sent1: The delegate attended the meeting on behalf of the manager.
meanings.sent2: The delegate from the company spoke eloquently at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The delegate wore a funny hat to the event, representing their team.
meanings.sent4: She was the delegate of change, bringing new ideas to the table.
meanings.sent5: The delegate's badge shone brightly, signifying their role.

meanings.definition: To entrust a task or responsibility to another.
meanings.sent1: I will delegate the project to my colleague while I'm away.
meanings.sent2: It's important to delegate tasks effectively in a team setting.
meanings.sent3: She decided to delegate the cooking duties to her cat, which was a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The manager had to delegate the decision-making process to his team.
meanings.sent5: He learned to delegate responsibilities to others to reduce his workload.

meanings.definition: To authorize someone to act on one's behalf.
meanings.sent1: I will delegate my assistant to sign the documents for me.
meanings.sent2: The CEO delegated the power to make financial decisions to the CFO.
meanings.sent3: She had to delegate her shopping to her dog, who came back with toys instead of groceries.
meanings.sent4: The captain delegated the responsibility of navigation to the first mate.
meanings.sent5: He had to delegate the task of organizing the event to his sister.
